basic.floral_language:
Graptopetalum paraguayense
Floriography: strong, brave, philanthropic.
This plant is a species of succulent plant in the jade plant family, Crassulaceae. Layout of the thick leaves is similar to a blooming Indian lotus. So the plant was called 'the flower never withered' and became very popular.
The plant requires sunny habitat. Flowering occasionally, white, five-pointed star shaped.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, blooms sometimes, blooms with white flowers in May-pointed star shape, red flower buds
basic.color: Leaf color emerald green , light purple

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes adequate sunshine, not afraid of strong sunlight, when in a short period of dormancy in summer, reduce water and shade properly
maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, water every 10-15 days
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered and dead leaves and excessive daughter plants
